        public final boolean getExitAtStop(TransitStopFacility stop)
        Description copied from interface: PTPassengerAgent
        Informs a passenger in a transit vehicle that the vehicle has arrived at the specified stop.
        Specified by:
        getExitAtStop in interface PTPassengerAgent
        Parameters:
        stop - the stop the vehicle arrived
        Returns:
        true if the passenger wants to exit the vehicle, false otherwise

        Parameters:
        line - the transit line that is available
        stopsToCome - the remaining stops on the route to be served by this vehicle before the trip ends
        transitVehicle - TODO
        Returns:
        true if the passenger wants to board the line, false otherwise

      • getWeight

        public final double getWeight()
        Specified by:
        getWeight in interface PTPassengerAgent
        Returns:
        a statistical weight, how many "real" agents this agent represents, e.g. "5.0" if you simulate a 20%-sample.

      • getCurrentLinkId

        public Id<Link> getCurrentLinkId()
        Description copied from interface: NetworkAgent
        Design comments:
        • Agent in many situations knows where he/she is. If not, return null.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentLinkId in interface NetworkAgent
        Returns:
        Id of current link. May be null (e.g. for teleporting agents)

      • getDestinationLinkId

        public Id<Link> getDestinationLinkId()
        Description copied from interface: NetworkAgent
        Design comments:
        • Originally, agents knew where they were going. This was then also used for teleportation. Since then, agents may not know where they are ultimately going. It might thus be more expressive to have "getDestinationLinkId" only for teleporting agents, and have "isArrivingOnCurrentLink" for all others (which would be parallel to how bus passengers handle this). If someone would find this better, and wants to refactor the code, then please go ahead. kai, nov'14
        Specified by:
        getDestinationLinkId in interface NetworkAgent
        Returns:
        Id of destination link. May be null (e.g. for cruising taxi drivers)

      • getVehicle

        public MobsimVehicle getVehicle()
        Description copied from interface: VehicleUsingAgent
        Design thoughts:
        • MZ states (in his AdapterAgent) that the DriverAgent should not have this reference. I am, in fact, not so sure (any more); maybe it is not so bad to have this. Clearly, symmetric connectors between objects would be better. kai, nov'11
        Specified by:
        getVehicle in interface VehicleUsingAgent

      • getMode

        public String getMode()
        Description copied from interface: NetworkAgent
        Convenience method for Leg.getMode(), in an attempt to get rid of getCurrentLeg(). If the agent is not on a leg, the behavior of this method is undefined (so don't rely on it).

        Comments:
        • Should be renamed to getLegMode(), in my opinion, as the mode of an agent can be anything else. mrieser/jan'12
        • I don't mind, but my current eclipse can't do the refactoring (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=293861). kai, jan'13
        Specified by:
        getMode in interface NetworkAgent
